dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Alright, so Facebook just dropped its latest transparency report, and, uh, it's pretty eye-opening. For the first time ever, it includes data from Instagram too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Alright, so Facebook just dropped its latest transparency report, and, uh, it's pretty eye-opening. For the first time ever, it includes data from Instagram too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The company revealed its sweeping efforts to police its own network in its latest biannual transparency report, which includes data from Instagram for the first time.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and the big takeaway, for me anyway, is just the sheer volume of, well, disturbing content they're reporting on. Especially, uh, child exploitation material.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and the big takeaway, for me anyway, is just the sheer volume of, well, disturbing content they're reporting on. Especially, uh, child exploitation material.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. I mean, they're saying they removed about 11.6 million pieces of content related to child nudity and sexual exploitation just in the third quarter alone. That's, like, double the first quarter.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. I mean, they're saying they removed about eleven point six million pieces of content related to child nudity and sexual exploitation just in the third quarter alone. That's, like, double the first quarter.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Facebook says that it removed about 11.6 million pieces of content it deemed to be child nudity and sexual exploitation of children in the third quarter, roughly double the number of pieces of content removed for the same reason in the first quarter.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Double! And they're trying to spin it as, "Oh, it's not that there's *more* harmful content, it's that we're working harder to find it."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Double! And they're trying to spin it as, Oh, it's not that there's more harmful content, it's that we're working harder to find it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Just because were reporting big numbers doesnt mean theres so much more harmful content happening on our services than others. ... What it says is were working harder to identify this and take action on it.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] But, um, Mark Zuckerberg's been under so much scrutiny for this, right? I mean, he just faced a congressional hearing last month.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But, um, Mark Zuckerberg's been under so much scrutiny for this, right? I mean, he just faced a congressional hearing last month.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Mark Zuckerberg Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg has faced increasing scrutiny over his failed efforts to curtail the spread of child exploitation on Facebook, which came to a crescendo at a congressional hearing last month.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, Representative Ann Wagner really, uh, scolded him, basically saying he's not working hard enough. And then there's the whole encryption thing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, Representative Ann Wagner really, uh, scolded him, basically saying he's not working hard enough. And then there's the whole encryption thing.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Representative Ann Wagner (R-MO) scolded Zuckerberg at the hearing, saying, You are not working hard enough, and end-to-end encryption is not going to help the problem.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, the encryption. That's the big point of contention. FBI Director Christopher Wray was pretty vocal about it.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, the encryption. That's the big point of contention. F B I Director Christopher Wray was pretty vocal about it.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: FBI Director Christopher Wray has also been critical of Facebooks plan to encrypt all of its users messages in the near future.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: He was. He, uh, called Facebook's plan for end-to-end encryption across all services a "dream come true for child pornographers." That's a strong statement.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: He was. He, uh, called Facebook's plan for end-to-end encryption across all services a dream come true for child pornographers. That's a strong statement.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Wray says that it would be a dream come true for child pornographers.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And it's not just the FBI. The New York Times, like, reported that Facebook Messenger was responsible for nearly 12 million of the 18.4 million worldwide reports of child sexual abuse material.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And it's not just the F B I. The New York Times, like, reported that Facebook Messenger was responsible for nearly twelve million of the eighteen point four million worldwide reports of child sexual abuse material.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The New York Times in September claimed that Facebook Messenger was responsible for nearly 12 million of the 18.4 million worldwide reports of child sexual abuse material.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: So, Zuckerberg, on a press call, essentially said these vast numbers are actually, like, a *positive* thing for the industry?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: So, Zuckerberg, on a press call, essentially said these vast numbers are actually, like, a positive thing for the industry?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: During a press call with reporters on Wednesday, Zuckerberg responded to concerns about the vast amount of child exploitation content found on the companys networks, claiming that it was actually a positive thing for the industry and society.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Yeah, he, uh, he argued that it shows they're just working harder to identify and take action on this type of content than other platforms are.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, he, uh, he argued that it shows they're just working harder to identify and take action on this type of content than other platforms are.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: But what it says is were working harder to identify and take action on this [type of content] more than others are.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: But how does that, you know, square with the encryption plan? Because if everything's encrypted, it inherently makes it harder for them to see what's being shared.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But how does that, you know, square with the encryption plan? Because if everything's encrypted, it inherently makes it harder for them to see what's being shared.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right, he, um, actually acknowledged that tension. He said encryption *does* make it harder to see content. But then he pivoted, saying they can still detect violations through "behavior patterns."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, he, um, actually acknowledged that tension. He said encryption does make it harder to see content. But then he pivoted, saying they can still detect violations through behavior patterns.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: At a high level youre pointing to a real tension, which is that encryption makes it harder for us to see some of the content in the services, he said. ... He said content violations can often be detected through behavior patterns, such as who is messaging whom.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, so like, who's messaging whom, the activity of the accounts, rather than the actual content itself?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, so like, who's messaging whom, the activity of the accounts, rather than the actual content itself?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: We can look at patterns of bad activity, he said. We look at the patterns of activity of the accounts.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. That's their proposed workaround for, uh, policing content in an encrypted environment.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. That's their proposed workaround for, uh, policing content in an encrypted environment.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Hmm. Still, it's, um, it's a huge problem they're grappling with.
